Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <anglersec> Ok. So what's the deal with the Hush price decrease?  New Kids on the Block? Calm before the Storm? What?

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <blankmac - BasementPool> There is almost no volume on Hush.  The price is essentially meaningless at the moment.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> think of it this way. if nobody buys hush, the price does not change in USD. But if people buy Bitcoin and the price goes up in USD- that inherently makes Hush Satoshi level lower. it is not that people are dumping hush, it is that people are buying bitcoin more than people are buying hush

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> Alts are decoupling from Bitcoin for the first time in years. There will be much more pain before there will be light

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <anglersec> @RunningMantheCoin damn good explanation.  So the question becomes when do people buy into alts.  They definitely arent dead.  At least, not the privacy coins

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> but rest assured- cryptocurrencies like hush are bubbles that cannot pop. They will always be around. and one day- our hush bubble will grow again. Much larger than the last

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> @anglersec historically, Bitcoin ruled the crypto world. In 2017, with the creation of ethereum contracts that let anybody mint coins, a massive shift occured. People with the know-how created new coins and marketed the living crap out of them. Then the world saw and bought them- only to realize they have no use case as ERC20 tokens. It was all a big sham (or at least 99% of it was). What we are seeing now, is the dumping of all those ERC20's and Bitcoin dominance rising to levels we havent seen in over 2 years. Is it painful? Yes. But it is also an opportunity

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> unfortunatley for nearly every coin that is not bitcoin- a shadow was casted. Having a high bitcoin dominance level in the crypto world is healthy. Having a low bitcoin dominance is sign of too much hopium for shitcoins

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> But rest assured- once Bitcoin rallies past its ATH of $20k (19.8 if you wanna be technical) the world will once again FOMO into bitcoin and send it to unimaginable heights (50-100k in my opinion). After this occurs, pepole who are new to crypto will see that some altcoins go up faster than bitcoin does, until the FOMO from Bitcoin transfers to the FOMO of altcoins just like the end of 2017

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> It is a very long cycle. Most people think the next Bitcoin FOMO cycle will happen from 2020-2021

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> It is therefore highly likely that the Altcoin FOMO will happen near the end of the Bitcoin FOMO. So you can expect coins like Hush to skyrocket near the end of 2021 if the logirithmic charts play out like most think they will

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> obviously, I could be totally wrong. But history repeats itself more often then most may think. It is about being prepared

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> TL;DR as long as Bitcoin rallies, Coins like hush will suffer. However, once the momentum switches to Altcoins, you will be happy you are here reading this right now

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <anglersec> Many thanks @RunningMantheCoin

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> My focus is on increasing the price of Hush via making it useful, it's an "application coin", you use it do something, that is it's first reason to have value. Owning Hush = the ability to communicate privately, now and in the future. So you can also think of it as a "Store-of-Privacy". That is how it gets intrinsic value, in my mind. Speculation of future value is a secondary thing

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> And since it's has a very small total supply, if you use some privacy now, well you lesson your future store-of-privacy. Or you mine/buy more Hush. That is what gives Hush value. Privacy.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> If you value Privacy a lot, you probably will value Hush a lot. If you don't value Privacy, you won't value Hush.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> People who care most about Privacy will set the cost of Hush, because they will want to acquire it. They will dance with miners to find a middle ground of price

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I can tell you right now that a new wave of ASICs were just delivered, the A9++'s from Innosilicon. You can mine ZEC/ZEN/HUSH/KMD with them. And that is definitely related to our current price plunge. Miners are selling to cover their costs (which are many)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> And that just feeds into the larger correction we are in

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Until we hit the first Hush halving in ~500 days, we are in the golden ages of mining and buying Hush on the cheap

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> This is my long-term view. I have no idea what the price of Hush will be between now and then, but the halving will very much change the price that miners will sell at. The price of ARRR changed drastically just after their recent halving
